track.name: My Foolish Heart
comments: time of your life a timeless line runs through Bill's phrasing making it mesmerising, measured and magical, melodic and meaningful, memorable and mellow.
No words can describe the intimate atmosphere this piece of music builds on the air.
sentimental, soulful, sensitive......simply the best jazz pianist for that
Two of the very best...simply wonderful
Pure perfection. One of my most favorite tracks of all times.
Thanks for the info Mega.  I enyoy both artists, but wasn't aware they'd ever recorded together.  They're both in good form here...I particularly enjoyed evan's solo...a very nice track.
fuck, it blowens my mind how damn good he is.

The Tony Bennett Bill Evans Album is a 1975 album by the singer Tony Bennett, accompanied by the pianist Bill Evans.
Their second album together, Together Again was released in 1977. Both albums plus alternate takes and additional tracks were released on The Complete Tony Bennett/Bill Evans Recordings by Fantasy in 2009.
(excerpted from wiki)
Very good indeed , but it can't compare to the version on Sunday at the Village Vanguard (best piano jazz album ever).
